p: Regarding the aromatic herb industry, basil, sage, and rosemary generate several kind of wastes resulting from pruning, packaging, or distillation processes. It was proved that wastewater from the distillation of these herbs contains important metabolites such as glycosylated flavonoids and caffeic acid derivatives, above all, rosmarinic acid [ 78]. Wastewater generated from aescin (a saponin from horse chestnuts) production contains kaempferol and quercetin [ 79].
